dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, big news this week from, uh, the Pentagon. Turns out, they actually haven't spent *anything* at President Trump's Scottish resort, Turnberry, since he took office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, big news this week from, uh, the Pentagon. Turns out, they actually haven't spent anything at President Trump's Scottish resort, Turnberry, since he took office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? That'sâ€¦ interesting. I thought, you know, there'd be all sorts of concern about that. What's the scoop?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? That's... interesting. I thought, you know, there'd be all sorts of concern about that. What's the scoop?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, um, according to a press release from the House Oversight Committee. They're saying it's actually due to positive feedback and, importantly, financial savings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, um, according to a press release from the House Oversight Committee. They're saying it's actually due to positive feedback and, importantly, financial savings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Financial savings? So, like, they *chose* not to spend there because it was, what, more expensive?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Financial savings? So, like, they chose not to spend there because it was, what, more expensive?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The military crews, um, stopped using Trump Turnberry for overnight stopovers. Politico reported on it. They looked into a decline in Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The military crews, um, stopped using Trump Turnberry for overnight stopovers. Politico reported on it. They looked into a decline in Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The House Oversight and Reform Committee had originally asked in June about a surge in Air Force flights stopping at Glasgow Prestwick Airport in Scotland. Various crews have been put up 30 miles away, at Trump Turnberry, during overnight stopovers, Politico first reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, effectively, they just found a better, cheaper option. I guess that makes sense. [interrupts] When did this start?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, effectively, they just found a better, cheaper option. I guess that makes sense. When did this start?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, exactly. And yeah, Defense Department records show no money spent there since August 2017. So, for most of his presidency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, exactly. And yeah, Defense Department records show no money spent there since August twenty seventeen. So, for most of his presidency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, how much are we talking about in terms of, like, savings?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, how much are we talking about in terms of, like, savings?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the average cost was around $189 a night. That's, uh, like, 660 individual rooms not paid for. Plus, there was an additional $60,000 that wasn't spent at the resort, which the Pentagon says was used to buy food elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the average cost was around one hundred eighty nine dollars a night. That's, uh, like, six hundred sixty individual rooms not paid for. Plus, there was an additional sixty thousand dollars that wasn't spent at the resort, which the Pentagon says was used to buy food elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for. There was also about $60,000 spent at the resort that could not be tied to actual travel vouchers, with the Pentagons letter suggesting that it could have been used on meals and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. You know, Trump always maintained he had a really strong, distinct line between his official duties and his commercial interests. This, uh, kinda lines up with that, in a way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. You know, Trump always maintained he had a really strong, distinct line between his official duties and his commercial interests. This, uh, kinda lines up with that, in a way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has almost routinely mixed his official duties and commercial interests while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It does, it does. And even the Democratic House Oversight Committee, while, you know, they celebrated the Pentagon's response, they still noted that far *less* taxpayer funds have been spent at the President's resort. So, it's a positive for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It does, it does. And even the Democratic House Oversight Committee, while, you know, they celebrated the Pentagon's response, they still noted that far less taxpayer funds have been spent at the President's resort. So, it's a positive for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And this isn't just about Scotland either, is it? Like, I feel like I've heard similar stories about other Trump properties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And this isn't just about Scotland either, is it? Like, I feel like I've heard similar stories about other Trump properties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You got it. This isn't the first time there's been, um, no concern over Trump using his office to benefit his business. In fact, spending at *all* Trump properties by political groups, even his own campaign, has actually decreased significantly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You got it. This isn't the first time there's been, um, no concern over Trump using his office to benefit his business. In fact, spending at all Trump properties by political groups, even his own campaign, has actually decreased significantly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This isnt the first time theres been concern over Trump using the office of the presidency to benefit his business. Since he took office, spending at Trump properties by political candidates or organizations, including Trumps own campaign, has surged.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, the D.C. hotel, for instance, isn't, uh, the hotspot everyone expected?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the D C hotel, for instance, isn't, uh, the hotspot everyone expected?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump hotel in Washington D.C., for instance, has become a hotspot for various lobbyists and political figures hoping to garner favor with the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nope. Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington counted at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials, and over 110 foreign officials from almost 60 countries who have avoided Trump properties in the last two years alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope. Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington counted at least ninety members of Congress, two hundred fifty administration officials, and over one hundred ten foreign officials from almost sixty countries who have avoided Trump properties in the last two years alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, despite all the initial worries, it looks like there was actually a pretty strong pushback, or at least a conscious effort, to avoid those entanglements. That's, um, quite a story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, despite all the initial worries, it looks like there was actually a pretty strong pushback, or at least a conscious effort, to avoid those entanglements. That's, um, quite a story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has almost routinely mixed his official duties and commercial interests while in office. Since he took office, spending at Trump properties by political candidates or organizations, including Trumps own campaign, has surged.
